Posts.Title: About to start my chemo journey

Posts.Content: hey all, new to this world and just wanted to give a wave. A bit about me, Found a lump in October after a lovely family holiday, was diagnosed in November and have since been through the lumpectomy/radiotherapy mill. On the last day of radiotherapy my consultant advised chemo to limit chances of the bugger coming back. That was last Friday. To say I’m knocked for 6 is a bit of an understatement as didn’t think I’d need it. But it is what it is, and I’d never forgive myself if it came back knowing I hadn’t done all I could to stop it. that said, am totally dreading it. Have flicked through a few forums and threads and know reactions to treatment are varied so not sure what I need here really. Guess I just know I’ll need some support and contact with people who’ve been through it and understand the journey.  From what I’ve what read so far though, so many brave souls in here. We’ll get through this cos there’s no option but to, right? :) x

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn, Thanks for your reply and sorry to hear you’re going through it too. The more I hear from ‘normal’ people the less fearful I am. The media just overloads you with horror stories and how awful it is so it’s a bit hard not to feel scared when you hear the dreaded C word (that applies for both cancer and chemo!). to be honest my onco did go through the detail of what chemo treatment I’d be having but it was such a haze as there was so much to process. I want to say it was EC&T treatment? 4 round of EC and 4 rounds of the T part, each session 3 weeks apart. I have a pre-chemo chat on Tuesday so will aim to understand it more then.  Good to know about the sickness pills as I’m not very good with nausea so will do my all to avoid that.  Did you go for cold cap at all? And did you find you got any headaches after treatment? I’ve been offered cold cap but still in 2 minds, due to time it adds but also the stories of discomfort and headaches. Part of me is keen to try out some fun wigs and headpieces! Just to try and get some fun out of the whole thing!  Hope your next treatment goes well and effects aren’t too bad this time xx
